result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Bahena was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is sentenced to 5 days in the Dane County Jail.  That jail term is stayed for completion of 32 hours of community service.
$643 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Civil filing fee of $204.50 pursuant to sec 814.61(1)(d) & (e) & service fee pursuant to sec 814.70(1) from case 22CV675 to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

allowing participation in the Community Service Program, copy given to Defn in court, emailed to CSP

10:25 AM Defendant Michael A Bahena in court.  Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defn waives right to atty. CT accepts as knowingly, intelligently, and voluntarily. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT # 1
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 5 days in Dane County Jail, with Huber; stayed pending completion of Community Service Program 

-Days credit to jail: 1

Ct #1
-DA surcharge
- All CC and DNA surcharge, V/W surcharge and DA surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-DNA on file

-Defendant advised of post-conviction rights

Casee T

2:18 PM Defendant Michael A Bahena in court.  Prosecuting attorney Tracy L McMiller in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defn requests plea/sentencing, will be pro se. Notice given to Defn court.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael A Bahena in court. Defn received offer, not sure if will want atty. CT sets another PTC, notice given to Defn in court.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Alyssa S except through a third party only for the purposes of arranging child custody or placement. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall abide by the Injunction issued in Dane County Case No. 22CV675. 
Trial Judge - Br 12

08:59 AM Defendant appeared.  Trisha L Simmons appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
